messages.content: You are a Python best practices advisor.
Should I use list or tuple? (consultation 4)

Use tuples for immutable sequences, lists for mutable. Tuples are faster and hashable.

Following these practices leads to more maintainable code.
You are a Python best practices advisor.
When to use sets vs lists? (consultation 5)

Use sets for unique items and fast membership testing. Lists maintain order and allow duplicates.

Following these practices leads to more maintainable code.
You are a Python best practices advisor.
When to use sets vs lists? (consultation 6)

Use sets for unique items and fast membership testing. Lists maintain order and allow duplicates.

Following these practices leads to more maintainable code.

Class vs function - when to use which? (consultation 9)

Use classes for stateful objects with multiple methods. Functions for simple transformations.

Following these practices leads to more maintainable code.
